title: A year in Europe,
author: Moore, Walter William
snippet: On my former visit, I had made a detour from Perth, in this same direction, for the purpose of seeing Logieal- mond, the "Drumtochty" of Ian Maclaren, which is only a few miles from Crieff, and had visited the Free Church, in which the young pastor of the Bonnie Brier Bush stories preached "his mother's sermon," and "spoke a gude word for Jesus Christ" ; and the Established Church, where, under a big elm, the nippy tongue of Jamie Soutar was wont to wag on Sunday mornings ; and the farm of Burnbrae, and other places in the glen which has now become  so famous. I am sorry to say that Dr. John Watson' s later development, both theological and literary, has not been so satisfactory as was once expected.
